intro: Potentilla dombeyi var. dombeyi, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features wiry stems and small, palmately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are bright yellow and occur in clusters, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
